glsa.title: Ethereal: Multiple vulnerabilities in protocol dissectors
glsa.synopsis: Ethereal is vulnerable to numerous vulnerabilities, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or abnormal termination.

background.p: Ethereal is a feature-rich network protocol analyzer.

description.p: There are numerous vulnerabilities in versions of Ethereal prior to 0.10.13, including:

ul.li: The SLIM3 and AgentX dissectors could overflow a buffer (CVE-2005-3243).
iDEFENSE discovered a buffer overflow in the SRVLOC dissector (CVE-2005-3184).
Multiple potential crashes in many dissectors have been fixed, see References for further details.

description.p: Furthermore an infinite loop was discovered in the IRC protocol dissector of the 0.10.13 release (CVE-2005-3313).

impact.p: An attacker might be able to use these vulnerabilities to crash Ethereal or execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Ethereal, which could be the root user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ethereal users should upgrade to the latest version:
